document.docTitle: Echiniscus ganczareki Michalczyk & Kaczmarek, 2007, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Echiniscus ganczareki, a new species of Tardigrada (Heterotardigrada: Echiniscidae, bigranulatus group) from Costa Rica

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Echiniscus ganczareki, a new species of Tardigrada (Heterotardigrada: Echiniscidae, bigranulatus group) from Costa Rica

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined: Holotype (female) and
24 adults
(
18 females
+
6 males
) from the type locality in Costa Rica . The holotype and 14 paratypes (
10 females
+
4 males
) were mounted in Hoyer’s medium and 10 paratypes (
8 females
+
2 males
) were prepared for SEM.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4.
Echiniscus ganczareki
sp. nov.
Habitus: 1— dorsal view (holotype, PCM); 2— dorso-lateral view (paratype, PCM); 3— dorsal view (paratype, SEM); 4— lateral view (paratype, SEM).

FIGURES 5–10.
Echiniscus ganczareki
sp. nov. 5–8—
dorsal plate cuticle; 5— terminal plate with pores; 6— the same fragment as shown on Fig. 5 , but showing pillars that appear when focusing down through the cuticle ( 5–6 – holotype, PCM); 7— pores in the scapular plate (paratype, SEM); 8— structure of the dorsal plate cuticle (see also Fig. 25 ) (paratype, SEM); 9–10— ventral head cuticle with pores ( 9— holotype, PCM, 10— paratype, SEM).

FIGURES 11–14.
Echiniscus ganczareki
sp. nov. 11–12—
second median plate, note that the anterior portion of the plate is devoid of pores and is covered with fine granulation ( 11— paratype, PCM, 12— paratype, SEM); 13–14— third median plate ( 13— paratype, PCM, 14— paratype, SEM).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Results of simple statistical analysis of measurements of selected morphological structures for
15 specimens
(including the holotype ) are given in
Table 1
. No juveniles, larvae or eggs were found.

Type locality:
Central America , Costa Rica , Cartago Province, Volcán Irazú National Park, liverwort from tree trunk, near the top of volcano, ca. 3400 m asl,
9 o 59 ' N
,
83 o 51 ' W
;
17 December 2002
; leg. Ł. Kaczmarek.
Geographic distribution: Known only from the type locality.

Type depositories:
Holotype and 7 paratypes are preserved at the Natural Sciences Collection, Faculty of Biology, A. Mickiewicz University, Umultowska 89, 61- 614 Poznań, Poland ; 7 paratypes are preserved in the collection of Ł. Michalczyk.
Etymology: The new species is dedicated to the first author’s very dear friend Joanna ‘ mzn ’ Ganczarek.
